channel.title: News, Politics, Opinion, Commentary, and Analysis
channel.description: In-depth reporting, commentary on breaking news, political analysis, and opinion from The New Yorker.

item.title: A British Nurse Was Found Guilty of Killing Seven Babies. Did She Do It?
item.description: Colleagues reportedly called Lucy Letby an “angel of death,” and the Prime Minister condemned her. But, in the rush to judgment, serious questions about the evidence were ignored.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Aviv

item.title: Do Children Have a “Right to Hug” Their Parents?
item.description: Hundreds of counties around the country have ended in-person jail visits, replacing them with video calls and earning a cut of the profits.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Stillman

item.title: Tabula Rasa: Volume Four, by John McPhee
item.description: A project meant not to end.
item.dc:creator: John McPhee

item.title: Miranda July Turns the Lights On
item.description: A few years ago, July began writing a novel, “All Fours,” about how middle age changes sex, marriage, and ambition. Then the novel changed her.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Schwartz

item.title: Why We’re Turning Psychiatric Labels Into Identities
item.description: So you’re on the spectrum, or you’ve got borderline personality disorder, or you’re a sociopath: once you’re sure that’s who you are, you’ve got a personal stake in a very creaky diagnostic system.
item.dc:creator: Manvir Singh

item.title: An Israeli Newspaper Presents Truths Readers May Prefer to Avoid
item.description: Haaretz consistently attempts to wrestle with the realities of what is going on in Israel, Gaza, and the West Bank.
item.dc:creator: David Remnick

item.title: What’s Holding Up Trump’s Florida Case?
item.description: Judge Aileen Cannon has said, in effect, that the case has become too complicated to proceed sooner. Unfortunately, that may be true.
item.media:keywords: Donald Trump, Classified Documents, Law, Mar-a-Lago, 2024 Presidential Election, Politics
item.dc:creator: Amy Davidson Sorkin

item.title: Israel’s Politics of Protest
item.description: As demonstrations roil American campuses, the Israeli right is using them to its own ends.

item.dc:creator: Ruth Margalit

item.title: Should We Be Worried About Bird Flu?
item.description: According to the C.D.C., the risk to public health remains low. But the country’s initial approach has had an unsettling resonance with the first months of COVID.
item.dc:creator: Dhruv Khullar

item.title: Gaza’s Unexploded-Bomb Crisis
item.description: Clearing the territory of ordnance and rubble could pose a challenge unseen since the Second World War.
item.dc:creator: Isaac Chotiner

item.title: How Much Aid Is Actually Reaching Gazans?
item.description: The chief economist of the U.N.’s World Food Programme on imminent famine and what’s needed to avoid it.
item.media:keywords: Palestine, Palestinians, Gaza, Starvation, Famine, Israel, Israelis

item.title: Elliott Abrams and the Contradictions of U.S. Human-Rights Policy
item.description: The longtime State Department official and Iran-Contra player on Israel’s war in Gaza and his own record in Latin America.

item.title: How Gaza’s Largest Mental-Health Organization Works Through War
item.description: Dr. Yasser Abu-Jamei on providing counselling services to Palestinian children: “When relatives are killed, we try somehow to calm the child and then ask questions: What are you going to do tomorrow? What are you going to do the day after tomorrow?”
item.media:keywords: Gaza, Palestine, Palestinians, Israel, Israelis, Mental Health, War, Trauma
item.dc:creator: Isaac Chotiner

item.title: Biden’s Public Ultimatum to Bibi
item.description: A hostage and ceasefire deal between Hamas and Israel is “not dead,” a senior U.S. official says, but only if Netanyahu holds off on invading Rafah.
item.media:keywords: (Prime Minister) Benjamin Netanyahu, Joe Biden, Israel, Israelis, Gaza, U.S. Foreign Policy, War

item.title: Is 2024 Doomed to Repeat 1968 or 2020—or Both?
item.description: Donald Trump has now made clear that he won’t concede if he loses the election. Believe him.
item.media:keywords: 2024 Presidential Election, Donald Trump, Capitol Riot
item.dc:creator: Susan B. Glasser

item.title: The Other Side of the River
item.description: Millions of Palestinians live in Jordan, where rage about the suffering in Gaza has reached a boiling point. Can the country’s leaders, who have a long-standing peace agreement with Israel, keep things under control?
item.media:keywords: Jordan, Israeli-Palestinian Conflict, Protests, Gaza, Middle East, Humanitarian Aid
item.dc:creator: Rania Abouzeid

item.title: The United States Passed a Ban on TikTok. Why?
item.description: Is TikTok the killer app of social media—or a Trojan horse sent by the enemy? Two views on the recent ban. Plus, salmon in the dishwasher, and more highlights of culinary TikTok.
item.category: Podcast / The New Yorker Radio Hour
item.media:keywords: Podcasts, TikTok, Cooking, Social Media, China, Audio

item.title: The Radical Case for Free Speech
item.description: We need to build a broad moral consensus around the universal right to dissent, rooted in widely held beliefs about American liberty.

item.title: The Progressive Running to End the Dominance of Coal in West Virginia

item.title: The Kids Are Not All Right. They Want to Be Heard
item.description: What explains the student movement against the war in Gaza? Sometimes the correct answer is the one right in front of you.

item.title: Can Suing People for Lying Save Democracy?
item.description: The lawyers at Protect Democracy have brought defamation suits against Rudy Giuliani, Kari Lake, and Project Veritas, hoping to limit the spread of disinformation. Others worry that their efforts could impinge on freedom of speech.

item.title: The New Yorker Wins Two 2024 Pulitzer Prizes
item.description: The staff writer Sarah Stillman was honored for reporting on a draconian legal doctrine, and the first-time contributor Medar de la Cruz was recognized for an illustrated piece about Rikers Island.
item.media:keywords: Pulitzer Prize, Disable Inline Signup Unit
item.dc:creator: The New Yorker

item.title: War in Gaza, Shibboleths on Campus
